title.narrative: ALTERNATIVE CARE

description.narrative: Children and adolescents are deinstitutionalized and have increased access to family and community-based care options., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children and adolescents live in safer environments, where they are increasingly protected from violence and exploitation.

related-activity.ref: 2850/A0/06/883 PROTECTION OF CHILDREN FROM VIOLENCE AND EXPLOITATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents are deinstitutionalized and have increased access to family and community-based care options.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued promoting;a;comprehensive Care Reform;Strategy. UNICEF presented a vision paper and a roadmap proposal to the National Welfare Agency identifying short-, medium-, and long-term actions to advance in the comprehensive Care System Reform, based on the situation analysis conducted by UNICEF. UNICEF also continued supporting and expanding foster care programs for children and adolescents deprived of family care at federal Level in Mexico City and the states of Chihuahua and Durango, including 5 migrant children among its beneficiaries, reaching 123 children in total. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/01/2022
